metadata.Title: CVE-2021-30004 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In wpa_supplicant and hostapd 2.9, forging attacks may occur because AlgorithmIdentifier parameters are mishandled in tls/pkcs1.c and tls/x509v3.c.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> this issue only affects the internal wpa ssl code. On Ubuntu, wpa is built with OpenSSL, so the affected files aren't used at all

criterions.comment: wpa: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
